-- Hoogle documentation, generated by Haddock
-- See Hoogle, http://www.haskell.org/hoogle/


-- | A pure-Haskell (no FFI) module for accessing terminfo databases
--   
--   This module can acquire terminfo databases and query them for terminal
--   capabilities. For details of terminfo, consult the man pages for
--   term(5) and terminfo(5). This package is dead simple, and doesn't do
--   anything fancy with the capabilities themselves. It merely provides a
--   means for accessing them.
@package terminfo-hs
@version 0.1.0.1


-- | There is an egregious number of capabilities. They are sequestered in
--   this module to preserve namespace sanity.
--   
--   For descriptions of these, consult terminfo(5).
module System.Terminfo.Caps
data BoolTermCap
AutoLeftMargin :: BoolTermCap
AutoRightMargin :: BoolTermCap
NoEscCtlc :: BoolTermCap
CeolStandoutGlitch :: BoolTermCap
EatNewlineGlitch :: BoolTermCap
EraseOverstrike :: BoolTermCap
GenericType :: BoolTermCap
HardCopy :: BoolTermCap
HasMetaKey :: BoolTermCap

InsertNullGlitch :: BoolTermCap

instance Ord NumTermCap
instance Eq NumTermCap
instance Enum NumTermCap

instance Show NumTermCap
instance Ord StrTermCap
instance Eq StrTermCap
instance Enum StrTermCap
instance Bounded StrTermCap
instance Show StrTermCap


-- | This is a pure-Haskell (no FFI) module for accessing terminfo
--   databases, which contain characteristics, or capabilities, for the
--   various terminals such as screen, vt100, or xterm. Among other things,
--   the capabilities include the idiosyncratic character sequences needed
--   to send commands to the terminal. These commands include things like
--   cursor movement.
--   
--   For a deeper understanding of terminfo, consult the man pages for
--   term(5) and terminfo(5).
--   
--   There are three parts to this module: acquiring a terminfo database,
--   querying the database, and defining the capabilities.
--   
--   This module is dead simple, so a single example will hopefully suffice
--   to demonstrate its usage.
--   
--   <pre>
--   import System.Terminfo
--   import System.Terminfo.Caps as C
--   uglyExample :: IO (Maybe Int)
--   uglyExample = do
--       term &lt;- fromJust &lt;$&gt; lookupEnv "TERM"
--       db &lt;- <a>acquireDatabase</a> term
--       let maxColors (Right d) = <a>queryNumTermCap</a> d C.<a>MaxColors</a>
--       return $ maxColors db
--   </pre>
--   
--   <pre>
--   &gt;&gt;&gt; uglyExample
--   Just 256
--   </pre>
module System.Terminfo
acquireDatabase :: String -> IO (Either String TIDatabase)
queryBoolTermCap :: TIDatabase -> BoolTermCap -> Bool
queryNumTermCap :: TIDatabase -> NumTermCap -> Maybe Int

-- | As this is a dead simple module, no 'smart' handling of the returned
--   string is implemented. In particular, placeholders for buffer
--   characters and command arguments are left as-is. This will be
--   rectified eventually, probably in a separate module.
queryStrTermCap :: TIDatabase -> StrTermCap -> Maybe String
data TIDatabase
instance Show DBType
